articles.description: Former Louisiana-Lafayette OL O'Cyrus Torrence, who was an All-Sun Belt selection the last two years, will be reunited with Gators coach Billy Napier after committing to transferring to Florida.
articles.headline: Former Louisiana-Lafayette offensive lineman O'Cyrus Torrence to transfer to Florida Gators

images.name: cfp trophy [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: A proposal to expand the College Football Playoff has hit repeated roadblocks.

images.name: 210721 acc phillips photo [608x342]
images.caption: ACC commissioner Jim Phillips believes that "now is not the right time to expand the College Football Playoff."

images.name: What's next for the path to CFP expansion?
images.caption: Greg McElroy and Heather Dinich discuss how the committee can eventually come to an agreement and approve a deal for CFP expansion.

articles.description: Seven months and nine in-person meetings after revealing the proposal that was initially applauded, those who created the CFP expansion plan and publicized it have been unable to implement it.

categories.description: topic for all college football playoff content

articles.headline: Inside the College Football Playoff expansion stalemate, and what comes next

article.description: Devlin Hodges threw for two touchdowns and ran for another and rallied Samford in the second half to beat Furman 38-25 on Saturday.
article.headline: Hodges, Samford beat Furman 38-25
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Devlin Hodges threw for two touchdowns and ran for another and rallied Samford in the second half to beat Furman 38-25 on Saturday. Hodges had 402 yards passing and 45 rushing for the Bulldogs (4-4, 3-2 Southern Conference). Kelvin McKnight had 106 yards receiving and Jai'Rus Creamer had 103 yards receiving and a score. The Bulldogs trailed 19-10 midway through the third quarter when defensive lineman Ahmad Gooden returned a Darren Grainger fumble 58 yards for a Samford score. A Grainger interception after the kickoff set up a 9-yard scoring pass from Hodges to Chris Shelling and the Bulldogs went ahead 24-19 with 5:48 left in the third. Samford had a 10-3 lead early but Furman's Grayson Atkins added to his first-quarter field goal with three more in the second, from 50, 51, and 53 yards, and the Bulldogs found themselves trailing 12-10 at halftime. Grainger threw for 92 yards and a touchdown for the Paladins (2-4, 2-2).
